description: Freud's theories, defense mechanisms, and personality development

questions.question: Which of the following is not a contribution by Sigmund Freud?
questions.explanation: Sigmund Freud is credited with all the above-mentioned achievements except psychosocial theory (proposed by Erik Erikson). Contributions include: Free association, Interpretation of dreams, Psychoanalysis, Psychosexual development, Psychodynamic theory, Topographic theory, Structural theory of mind, and introducing cocaine in psychiatry.

questions.question: Which of the following principles is matched correctly with the part of the mind it works on?

options.a: Id- principle of reality, in the conscious domain
options.b: Ego- principle of pleasure, in the unconscious domain
options.c: Super Ego- principle of idealism, both in the conscious and unconscious domain
options.d: Id- defence mechanisms, in the unconscious domain

questions.explanation: The superego is based on the principle of idealism, both in the conscious and unconscious domain. It acts to perfect and civilize our behaviour. The id works on pleasure principle (unconscious), ego on reality principle (mostly conscious), and defense mechanisms are primarily handled by the ego.

questions.question: According to Sigmund Freud, we have a barrier in our mind called repression. This function is done by which of the following part of the mind?
questions.explanation: According to Sigmund Freud, the preconscious part of our mind has a barrier called repression. This barrier separates the contents of the unconscious and the conscious mind. The preconscious contains mental events that can be brought into conscious awareness by focusing attention.
